PerfectNetExp.abs: pettifog 挑剔pettifogger 讼棍pettifoggery 欺瞒

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from petty + obsolete fogger 'underhand dealer', probably from Fugger, the name of a family of merchants in Augsburg in the 15th and 16th cents

means.word_mean: 1. a person (especially a lawyer or politician) who uses unscrupulous or unethical methods
2. a disputant who quibbles; someone who raises annoying petty objections
